p: In a Chinese medical encyclopaedia in 992 from the Jin Dynasty (265–420 AD), dengue fever was referred as “water poison” associated with flying insects, but the term dengue fever came into general use only after 1828 ( Gupta et al., 2012). The earliest dengue epidemics occurred almost simultaneously in Asia, Africa, and North America in the 1780s and first clinical case report dates from 1789 of 1780 epidemic in Philadelphia is by Benjamin Rush, who coined the term “break bone fever” because of the symptoms of myalgia and arthralgia (quoted from http://www.globalmedicine.nl/index.php/dengue-fever).
